benchmark_details.name: CASA (Cultural and Social Awareness Benchmark)
benchmark_details.overview: CASA is a benchmark designed to assess LLM agentsâ€™ sensitivity to cultural and social norms across two web-based tasks: online shopping and social discussion forums. It evaluates the agents' ability to detect and appropriately respond to norm-violating queries and observations.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate LLM agents' cultural and social awareness in web-based environments.

data.source: Generated user queries and observations based on cultural and social taxonomies across 17 countries.
data.annotation: Validated by expert annotators from their respective cultures.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on agent responses to cultural and social norm violations.
methodology.interpretation: A higher score in AC-R, Edu-R, and Help-R indicates better cultural sensitivity, while a higher Vio-R indicates the agent's failure to recognize misleading content.
methodology.baseline_results: Current LLM agents show less than 10% awareness coverage and over 40% violation rates.
methodology.validation: Evaluated through a comprehensive multi-step validation process.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential for cultural insensitivity in agent responses.
